alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 412 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported several roads closed to to flooding across portions of North Charleston and Charleston. In addition, broadcast media and social media indicated numerous roads with deep standing water. Radar rainfall estimates and automated range gauges indicate between 3 to 4 inches of rain has fallen across Charleston, North Charleston, West Ashely this afternoon. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area by 530 PM. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Johns Island, West Ashley, James Island, Downtown Charleston, Hollywood, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Maybank Bridge, James Island County Park, Charles Towne Landing, Wadmalaw Island, Magnolia Gardens, Fort Johnson, Angel Oak Park and Oakland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
